def_cn: 事件;（尤指）特殊事件，重大事件
def_en: An event is something that happens, especially when it is unusual or important. You can use events to describe all the things that are happening in a particular situation.

def_cn: （社交聚会、体育比赛等有计划、有组织的）活动
def_en: An event is a planned and organized occasion, for example a social gathering or a sports match.

def_cn: （体育比赛等的）比赛项目
def_en: An event is one of the races or competitions that are part of an organized occasion such as a sports meeting.

def_cn: 万一发生…；如果是那样子的话；假若…
def_en: You use in the event of ,in the event that, and in that event when you are talking about a possible future situation, especially when you are planning what to do if it occurs.
You say in any event after you have been discussing a situation, in order to indicate that what you are saying is true or possible, in spite of anything that has happened or may happen.
You say in the event after you have been discussing what could have happened in a particular situation, in order to indicate that you are now describing what actually did happen.
